definition: to wait for a long time
class/rank/grade/equal to/same as/to wait for/to await/et cetera/and so on/et al. (and other authors)/after/as soon as/once

sentences.english: I’m sorry to have keep you waiting ,but he’s still not free.
sentences.chinese: 很抱歉，讓你久等，但他還是沒空。

sentences.english: Really sorry to keep you waiting.
No. 7:Sorry to have kept you waiting . Here is your Steamed Mandarin Fish .
sentences.chinese: 抱歉讓您久等了，這是您的清蒸桂魚。

sentences.english: A: Sorry to keep you waiting.
I am sorry to have kept you waiting for long.
I\'m sorry to have kept you waiting.
It appears that the prophet Habakkuk did not have to wait long before the Lord answered.
sentences.chinese: 很明顯的，先知哈巴谷並未久等不到上帝的回答。

sentences.english: I'm sorry to have kept you waiting. We were a little late in getting underway.
sentences.chinese: 真抱歉，讓你久等，我們出發時擔誤了一會兒。
習慣上我們通常說“久等”。

sentences.english: I'm really sorry. I'm sorry about keeping you waiting.
Sorry to have kept you waiting, sir. Bre there four pieces in all?
sentences.chinese: 欠不害羞讓您久等了，先生。您一共是四件行李對嗎？

sentences.english: I'm sorry for keeping you waiting.
H. W:I'm very sorry to have kept you waiting, sir.
sentences.chinese: 我很抱歉讓你久等了，先生。

sentences.english: This is Mary Zhang of Customer Service thank you for your patience.
sentences.chinese: 我是客戶部張瑪麗，讓你久等了。

definition: we are honored by your presence
variant of 耽擱|耽搁[dan1 ge5]
to go on an errand for nothing/to go on a wild-goose chase
(said by departing guest) no need to see me out
to put sb to trouble (of doing sth)/vexation/inconvenience
to make a journey for nothing
to hold one's breath (in anticipation) (idiom)/to anxiously await
